title: SQL ServerASCII()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerASCII()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the ASCII value of the first character in "CustomerName":
SELECT ASCII(CustomerName) AS NumCodeOfFirstChar
FROM Customers;

Definition and Usage
The ASCII() function returns the ASCII value for the specific character.
Syntax
ASCII(
character
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
character
Required. The character to return the ASCII value for. If more than one 
    character is entered, it will only return the value for the first character
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:

FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerASCII()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerASCII()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerASCII()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
